page.title: 12HOUSING IN HOCKWOLD
page.content: Houses in Hockwold fall into 4 main categories: {Farmhouses}and{cottages} built before 1900. These are mainly of flint, or chalk with some brickwork. { {Council}built 3-4 bedroom houses & 2 bedroom bungalows. The latter for the elderly. Brick{bungalows}with 2 or 3 bedrooms built in the late 1950's, mainly on one estate. A few {larger {houses}with 3 or 4 bedrooms built in the 1980's. Most of the owner occupied modern dwellings have garages, all have inside bathrooms and toilets. In l981 there were 11 households without bathrooms or inside toilets. The local council adopt a policy of not approving planning permission outside the present housing perimeter. The eastern end of the village is a{ {Conservation Area.}
